result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Joseph Otero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: You are ordered to submit and comply with an assessment by the approved public treatment facility for your county of residence, as defined in s.51.45(2)(c), Wis. Stats and also complete Driver Safety Plan.

Must report to Dunn County jail on or before November 4th, 2022. 
Huber granted after serving 48 hours.
Expungement granted if fine of $1,504.00 is paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
3:45 PM Defendant Alexander Joseph Otero in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Court - makes record of DE's request to have counsel appear today.
DE - does not have an attorney. Would like to plea today. 
State - plea to Ct 1 and 4. Counts 2 and 3 will be DRI along with 21TR5719. Ct 1 - costs only $463.00. Ct 4 - AODA, Driver safety plan. No IID. 12 month revocation of DL. Fine of $1,504.00 which includes blood draw. 10 days jail. No Huber for first 48 hours. 60 days to report to jail. No restitution requested.
DE - understands agreement. Will proceed without counsel.
Court - goes over right to counsel. Finds DE knowingly waived right to counsel. Provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters No Contest plea to Count 1 and Count 4.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty of Count 1 and Count 4. 
Parties stipulate to the facts.
State - asks court to accept recommendation. Would be eligible for expungement on Count 1.
DE - makes a statement to the court.

Court orders -
22CM37
Count 1 - Costs of $463.00
Count 4 -
AODA and driver safety plan
No IID
12 month revocation of drivers license
10 days jail
Huber granted after serving 48 hours
Must report to jail on or before November 4th, 2022
Fine of $1,504.00
Expungement granted if fine is paid in full

22CM37 Count 2 and Count 3 - DRI
21TR5719 - DRI

2:45 PM Defendant Alexander Joseph Otero appeared by video without counsel.  Attorney Lucas D Arras in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk -EAM 
22CM37, 21TR5719
State:  Victim rights have been complied with.  Letter mailed to def with penalties.
Def: would like to pled today. Waives his personal appearance. Does not waive his right to an atty and would like to have an atty today for his plea.  
Off record 2:49 pm to set next hearing
On record 2:50 pm
Court sets new plea hearing on 09-06-2022 at 3:45 pm 
Court explains to defendant on how to contact PD office or apply for a court ordered atty  
State: IID is not required as part of this agreement
Def:  Asks about an occupational license
State:  Def should talk to his atty about this issue
Plea hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

8:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander Joseph Otero appeared by video. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CM37, 21TR5719
State - offer was made. DE does not have counsel. 
Court - makes record of last court appearance. Asks if DE wants counsel.
DE - will proceed without counsel. Rcvd offer from State. Will accept offer.
State - plea to Ct 1 and 4. Ct 2 and 3 and TR case will be dismissed. Ct 1 $463.00-cost only. Ct 4 $1,429.00, 12 mo DL revo. AODA and driver safety plan. 10 days jail. Unsure of IID. May be victim rights that need to be complied with before DE can plea.
DE - understands offer. Ready to plea today.
State - DE will not have to report to jail immediately. 
Court - explains victim rights to DE. Sets plea date. DE may appear via Zoom for plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on May 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DE - enters plea of No Contest. Waives reading of Complaint.
Court - enters NG plea on behalf of DE
